DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study human stable coronary artery disease ( CAD ) treatable percutaneous intervention ( PCI ) evaluate efficacy Enhanced External Counterpulsation ( EECP ) regard coronary collateral growth .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Hemodynamic Biological Effects ECP Exercise
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year , write informed consent participate study 1 . Pregnancy ( serum Î²HCG < 2 IU/l female volunteer ) Baseline History : 1 . Endurance exercise 5 day day exams 2 . History cardiovascular disease surgery , include arterial hypertension , Raynaud phenomenon , recurrent migraine , cardiac rhythm disorder 3 . History metabolic disorder , particularly diabetes mellitus 4 . History respiratory , renal , hepatic cerebral disease 5 . Allergic reaction Luminity component 6 . Cardiovascular medication 7 . Illness characterize acute phase response 8 . Anaemia haemoglobin level < 110 g/L Baseline Physical Examination : 1 . Peripheral artery disease Baseline Echocardiogram : 1 . Valvular heart disease 2 . Aortic aneurysm ( abnormality ascend aorta , aortic arch descend aorta ) 3 . Intra extracardiac shunt 4 . Systolic diastolic leave ventricular ( LV ) dysfunction 5 . LVhypertrophy 6 . Pulmonary arterial hypertension
